sentences.en: A role as senior diplomat would be a good alibi for his absence.
sentences.cn: 高级外交官的角色将是他缺席的上佳托词。

sentences.en: Do you have any proof to substantiate your alibi?
sentences.cn: 你有证据表明你当时不在犯罪现场 吗 ?

sentences.en: He established an alibi to the charge of murder.
sentences.cn: 他证实在谋杀案发生时他不在场.
他有案发时不在现场的充分证据.
他有不在场的确凿证据。

sentences.en: He manages to persuade both his wife and girlfriend to provide him with an alibi.
sentences.cn: 他设法说服他的妻子和女友都为他提供不在场的证明。

sentences.en: His alibi would not have withstood cross - examination .
sentences.cn: 他不在犯罪现场的证据应该不会经得起 盘问.
米克有确凿的不在场证据。

sentences.en: The accused had thrown dust in the eyes of the police by giving them a false alibi.
sentences.cn: 被告向警方提供伪证,以此转移了他们的视线.

sentences.en: The alibi was fabricated by him.
sentences.cn: 这种托辞是他臆造出来的.

sentences.en: The false alibi threw the police off the scent.
sentences.cn: 那个不在犯罪现场的伪证使警方失去了线索.

sentences.en: The police are suspicious of his alibi because he already has a record.
sentences.cn: 警方对他不在场的辩解表示怀疑,因为他已有前科.

sentences.en: The police verified that she had an airtight alibi.
sentences.cn: 警方查明她有着无懈可击的不在犯罪现场的证据.

sentences.en: The policeman saw through his false alibi.
sentences.cn: 警察识破他不在场的伪证.

sentences.en: Who would alibi for that guy?
sentences.cn: 谁会愿意为那个家伙辩解?

trans.tran_cn: 犯罪现场，<美口>辩解，托辞，[法]不在犯罪现场的抗辩事实
trans.tran_en: something that proves that someone was not where a crime happened and therefore could not have done it
